FieldValue.Value: Patients' experiences: percentage of parents/guardians who reported how often they were able to get timely appointments, needed care, and information for their child on the CAHPS Clinician & Group Child Visit Survey.
CAHPS® Clinician & Group Surveys. Child visit survey 2.0. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ); 2012 Jan 27. 8 p.
Patient experience measures from the CAHPS® Clinician & Group Surveys. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ); 2012 May 1. 22 p. [4 references]

MTH: Guardian ; Parents
SNOMEDCT_US: Consumer satisfaction questionnaire ; Guardian ; Parent of
Clinical Quality Measures: Patient Experience
Does not apply to this measure

This measure is used to assess the percentage of parents/guardians (respondents) who reported how often ("Never," "Sometimes," "Usually," or "Always") they were able to get timely appointments, needed care, and information for their child.

This "Getting Timely Appointments, Care, and Information" composite measure is based on five questions in the CAHPS Clinician & Group Child Visit Survey that asks how often:

  • Child got appointment for urgent care as soon as needed
  • Child got appointment for non-urgent care as soon as needed
  • Respondent got answer to medical question the same day he/she phoned provider's office
  • Respondent got answer to medical question as soon as he/she needed when phoned provider's office after hours
  • Child saw provider within 15 minutes of appointment time

The Visit Survey is meant to capture information about a patient's most recent visit. However, only questions about provider communication and office staff ask about the most recent visit. Questions about access to care use a 12-month reference period.

Note: A composite score is calculated in which a higher score indicates better quality. Composite scores are intended for consumer-level reporting.

The CAHPS Clinician & Group Surveys (CG-CAHPS) assess patients' experiences with health care providers and staff in providers' offices. Survey results can be used to:

  • Improve care provided by individual providers, sites of care, medical groups, or provider networks.
  • Equip consumers with information they can use to choose physicians and other health care providers, physician practices, or medical groups.

The Visit Survey asks patients to report on their experiences with providers and office staff at their most recent visit to a provider's office. This instrument addresses feedback from many users regarding the need for a CAHPS survey that focuses on experiences during a single visit rather than over a period of time. More targeted feedback about a visit can provide medical practices with valuable information for monitoring and improvement. Also, many physicians are accustomed to seeing survey results for a visit, which they sometimes perceive as more valid and credible.
CAHPS® Clinician & Group Visit Survey. [internet]. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ); 2011 Oct 26 [accessed 2012 Jan 25]. [2 p].
Read about the Clinician & Group Surveys. [internet]. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ); 2011 Oct 26 [accessed 2011 Nov 29]. [3 p].

The number of "Never," "Sometimes," "Usually," "Always" responses on the "Getting Timely Appointments, Care, and Information" questions (see the related "Numerator Inclusions/Exclusions" field)

Field.Name: Type of Evidence Supporting the Criterion of Quality for the Measure

FieldValue.Value: A formal consensus procedure, involving experts in relevant clinical, methodological, public health and organizational sciences
Focus groups

Field.Name: Additional Information Supporting Need for the Measure

FieldValue.Value: Unspecified

Development of the CAHPS Clinician & Group Survey included:

  • Field-testing with over a dozen organizations, including health plans, large medical groups, purchaser groups, physician boards, and others.
  • Cognitive interviewing in English and Spanish to determine how potential respondents understood and reacted to survey questions.

Patient/Individual (Consumer) Characteristic
not defined yet

Inclusions
All parents/guardians who answered the "Getting Timely Appointments, Care, and Information" questions on the CAHPS Clinician & Group Child Visit Survey

Include only patients (children 17 years or younger) who have had at least one visit to the selected provider in the target time frame. The target time frame is 3 months for the Visit Survey. Only questions about getting access to care refer to the last 12 months.

The total number in the denominator should include the following:

  • Refusals. The parent or guardian of the sampled child refused in writing or by phone to participate.
  • Nonresponse. The sampled child is presumed to be eligible but the parent or guardian did not complete the survey for some reason (never responded, was unavailable at the time of the survey, was ill or incapable, had a language barrier, and so on).
  • Bad addresses/phone numbers. In either case, the sampled child is presumed to be eligible but the parent or guardian was never located.

Exclusions

  • Deceased. In some cases, a household or family member may inform survey sponsor of the death of the sampled child.
  • Ineligible. The sampled child did not receive care from the participating medical group or health system in the last 12 months.
not defined yet

Inclusions
The number of "Never," "Sometimes," "Usually," "Always" responses on the "Getting Timely Appointments, Care, and Information" questions

The numerator includes completed questionnaires. A questionnaire is considered complete if responses are available for half of the key survey items*.

From the responses, a composite score is calculated in which a higher score indicates better quality.

Note: Refer to the Instructions for Analyzing Data from CAHPS® Surveys document in the "Companion Documents" field for additional information regarding data analysis.

*Refer to the Fielding the CAHPS® Clinician & Group Surveys: Sampling Guidelines and Protocols document in the "Companion Documents" field for additional information regarding the key items in the Clinician & Group Surveys.

Field.Name: Allowance for Patient or Population Factors

FieldValue.Value: not defined yet

Field.Name: Description of Allowance for Patient or Population Factors

FieldValue.Value:
The CAHPS Team recommends adjusting the survey data for respondent age, education, and general health status. This makes it more likely that reported differences are due to real differences in performance, rather than differences in the characteristics of enrollees or patients.

CAHPS recommends adjusting for the case-mix of the patients who evaluated each provider to allow comparison of scores across providers.

Refer to the original measure documentation for additional information on case-mix adjustment.

This is the current release of the measure.

The individual measure, "Getting Timely Appointments, Care, and Information," is published in the "CAHPS® Clinician & Group Child Visit Survey 2.0." This document is available from the CAHPS Web site.

For more information, contact CAHPS Technical Assistance.

The following are available:

  • Fielding the CAHPS® Clinician & Group Surveys: sampling guidelines and protocols. Document no. 1033. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ); 2011 Sep 1. 26 p. This document is available from the CAHPS Web site.
  • Instructions for analyzing data from CAHPS® surveys: using the CAHPS analysis program version 4.0. Document no. 2015. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ); 2011 Sep 1. 75 p. This document is available from the CAHPS Web site.

For more information, contact CAHPS Technical Assistance.
